titleStmt.title: A Versatile Chemo-Enzymatic Route to Enantiomerically Pure β-Branched-α-Amino Acids

address.addrLine: Unit 321 Cambridge Science Park Milton Road

analytic.title: A Versatile Chemo-Enzymatic Route to Enantiomerically Pure β-Branched-α-Amino Acids

application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents
application.label: a91ee48

startPage=-1, endPage=-1, consolidateCitations=0, consolidateHeader=0, consolidateFunders=0, includeRawAffiliations=false, includeRawCitations=true, includeRawCopyrights=false, generateTeiIds=false, generateTeiCoordinates=[0], sentenceSegmentation=false, flavor=null

div.p: IR absorption spectra were recorded on a Jasco-FT/IR-410 Spectrophotometer using standard techniques. 1 H and 13 C-NMR spectra were recorded on a Varian Gemini or Bruker AC250 spectrometer. Chemical shifts are reported in ppm.
Mass spectra were recorded on a Micromass Platform-2 under electrospray conditions or Magnetic Sector MS250 machine for FAB-MS.

Analytical normal phase HPLC was performed on a Chiracel OD-H column eluting with 1ml/min 5% IPA in Hexane at 210nm at 10°C. Reverse phase HPLC was performed on a Chirobiotic T column eluting with 0.7ml/min 40% ethanol in Water at 210nm. Peak intensities are reported to an accuracy of 0.1%.
Optical rotation was measured on an AA1000 polarimeter from Optical Activity Ltd (measurements made at the sodium D-line). Concentrations are given in g/100ml.
Column chromatography was carried out using Fisher silica 60A, particle size 35-70 micron).
Melting points were carried out on a Gallenkamp melting point apparatus with no corrections.

All solvents and reagents are standard laboratory grade and were obtained from commercial sources. The Trigonopsis variabilis D-amino acid oxidase was obtained from Sandoz. The porcine kidney D-amino acid oxidase and snake venom L-amino acid oxidase were obtained from Sigma.

1) Synthesis of (Z)-2-Acetylamino-3-iodo-but-2-enoic acid methyl ester 5 AcHN CO 2 Me I Me NIS (12.9g, 0.057mol) was added to a stirring solution of methyl 2-(N-acetylamino)-Z-butenoate 3 (7.50g, 0.048mol) in 2% TFA in CH 2 Cl 2 (250ml with 5ml TFA). The mixture was stirred at room temperature overnight. The mixture was cooled in an ice bath before triethylamine (20ml) was added slowly. The mixture was allowed to stir for a further hour. The mixture was concentrated and taken up in CH 2 Cl 2 , washed with 1M KHSO 4 , water and brine before concentrating and running down a column of silica (CH 2 Cl 2 /ethyl acetate 1:1) to obtain 5 as a yellow/brown solid (5.41g, 40%). ν max (KBr) 1518 (NH bend),1659 (C=O amide), 1717 (C=O ester), 3249 cm -1 (NH stretch); δ H (250MHz, CDCl 3 ) 2.15 (3H, s, CH 3 ), 2.80(3H, s, Ac), 3.84 (3H, s, CO 2 CH 3 ), 6.91(1H,s br., NH); δ C (63MHz, CDCl 3 ) 22.7 (CH 3 ), 28.8 (Ac), 52.5 (CO 2 CH 3 ), 102.1, 131.4, 161.4, 168.1 (C); m/z (FAB) 284 (MH + ); found (FAB) 283.97830 (MH + ), C 7 H 11 INO 3 requires 283.97837.

div.head: 2) General procedure for Suzuki couplings
div.p: A mixture of vinyl iodide 5, boronic acid, palladium acetate and sodium carbonate in ethanol was heated at 55°C for 4 hours.

The mixture was concentrated and taken up in CH 2 Cl 2 /water (1:1). The CH 2 Cl 2 layer was further washed once with water, once with brine and dried over MgSO 4 before concentrating to the crude product. Column chromatography (CH 2 Cl 2 /ethyl acetate 1:1) gave the pure product.

div.head: 2.1) Synthesis of (Z)-2-Acetylamino-3-phenyl-but-2-enoic acid methyl ester 6a
div.p: AcHN CO 2 Me

div.head: Me
div.p: The general procedure was followed using vinyl iodide 5 (400mg, 1.41mmol), phenylboronic acid (259mg, 2.12mmol), palladium acetate (32mg, 0.141mmol), sodium carbonate (300mg, 2.83mmol) and ethanol (15ml).
Wet flash column chromatography (CH 2 Cl 2 /ethyl acetate 1:1 gave 6a as a white solid (265mg, 81%).

ν max (nujol) 1532 (N-H bend), 1657 (C=O amide), 1720 (C=O ester), 3177cm -1 (N-H stretch); δ H (200MHz, CDCl 3 ) 1.85 (3H, s, CH 3 ), 2.24 (3H, s, Ac), 3.80 (3H, s, CO 2 CH 3 ), 6.56 (1H, s br., NH), 7.32-7.41 (5H, m, ArH); δ C (63MHz, CDCl 3 ) 20.5 (CH 3 ), 22.4 (Ac), 52.0 (CO 2 CH 3 ), 127.2, 128.0, 128.7 (C Ar ), 123.5, 137.5, 139.8, 165.5, 168.6 (C); m/z (FAB) 234 (MH + ); found (FAB) (MH + ) 234.11316; C 13 H 16 NO 3 requires 234.11302; TLC 0.27 (CH 2 Cl 2 / ethyl acetate 1:1). 2.2) Synthesis of (Z)-2-Acetylamino-3-(4-fluorophenyl)but-2-enoic acid methyl ester 6b AcHN CO 2 Me Me F

The general procedure was followed using vinyl iodide 5 (500mg, 1.77mmol), 4-fluorophenylboronic acid (371mg, 2.65mmol), palladium acetate (40mg, 0.177mmol), sodium carbonate (375mg, 3.53mmol) and ethanol (15ml).
Wet flash column chromatography (CH 2 Cl 2 /ethyl acetate 1:1) gave 6b as a white solid (341mg, 77%).

KBr) 1509 (NH bend),1654 (C=O amide), 1723 (C=O ester), 3280 cm -1 (NH stretch); δ H (250MHz, CDCl 3 ) 2.09 (3H, s, CH 3 ), 2.45 (3H, s, Ac), 4.02 (3H, s, CO 2 CH 3 ), 6.70 (1H,s br., NH), 7.23-7.46 (4H, m, ArH); δ C (63MHz, CDCl 3 ) 21.2 (CH 3 ), 23.0 (Ac), 52.6 (CO 2 CH 3 ), 116.1, 116.4,129.6, 129.7 (C Ar ), 124.2, 236.3, 137.9, 164.7, 165.9, 169.1 (C); m/z (FAB) 25 2(MH + ); found (FAB) 252.10362 (MH + ), C 13 H 15 FNO 3 requires 252.10360. 2.3) Synthesis of (Z)-2-Acetylamino-3-(4-trifluoromethylphenyl)but-2-enoic acid methyl ester 6c AcHN CO 2 Me Me F 3 C

The general procedure was followed using vinyl iodide 5 (400mg, 1.41mmol), 4-trifluoromethylphenylboronic acid (403mg, 2.12mmol), palladium acetate (32mg, 0.141mmol), sodium carbonate (300mg, 2.83mmol) and ethanol (15ml).

Wet flash column chromatography (CH 2 Cl 2 /ethyl acetate 1:1) gave 6c as a white solid (356mg, 84%). ν max (KBr) 1508 (NH bend),1682 (C=O amide), 1709 (C=O ester), 3306 cm -1 (NH stretch); δ H (250MHz, CDCl 3 ) 1.96 (3H, s, CH 3 ), 2.36 (3H, s ,Ac), 3.90 (3H, s, CO 2 CH 3 ), 6.57 (1H, s br., NH), 7.33-7.73 (4H, m, ArH); δ C (63MHz, CDCl 3 ) 20.4 (CH 3 ), 22.5 (Ac), 52.2 (CO 2 CH 3 ), 125.7, 127.7 (C Ar ), 124.2, 137.4, 143.8, 165.1, 168.7 (C); m/z (FAB) 302 (MH + ); found (FAB) 302.10071 (MH + ), C 14 H 15 F 3 NO 3 requires 302.10040.

div.head: 2.4) Synthesis of (Z)-2-Acetylamino-3-naphthalen-2-yl-but-2-enoic acid methyl ester 6d
div.p: AcHN CO 2 Me

div.head: Me
div.p: The general procedure was followed using vinyl iodide 5 (800mg, 2.82mmol), 2-naphthaleneboronic acid (729mg, 4.24mmol), palladium acetate (64mg, 0.242mmol), sodium carbonate (600mg, 5.66mmol) and ethanol (25ml).
Wet flash column chromatography (CH 2 Cl 2 /ethyl acetate 1:1) gave 6d as a pale yellow solid (575mg, 72%).

ν max (KBr) 1509 (NH bend),1650 (C=O amide), 1720 (C=O ester), 3298 cm -1 (NH stretch); δ H (250MHz, CDCl 3 ) 1.78 (3H, s, CH 3 ), 2.28 (3H, s, Ac), 3.77 (3H, s, CO 2 CH 3 ), 6.52 (1H, s br., NH), 7.28-7.80 (7H, m, ArH); δ C (63MHz,CDCl 3 )

div.head: 2.5) Synthesis of (Z)-2-Acetylamino-3-(3,5-dimethylphenyl)but-2-enoic acid methyl ester 6e
div.p: AcHN CO 2 Me Me Me

div.head: Me
div.p: The general procedure was followed using vinyl iodide 5 (400mg, 1.41mmol), 3,5-dimethylphenylboronic acid (318mg, 2.12mmol), palladium acetate (32mg, 0.141mmol), sodium carbonate (300mg, 2.83mmol) and ethanol (15ml).
Wet flash column chromatography (CH 2 Cl 2 /ethyl acetate 1:1) gave 6e as a white solid (301mg, 82%).

div.head: 2.6) Synthesis of (Z)-2-Acetylamino-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)but-2-enoic acid methyl ester 6f
div.p: AcHN CO 2 Me

div.head: MeO
div.p: The general procedure was followed using vinyl iodide 5 (500mg, 1.77mmol), 4-methoxyphenylboronic acid (403mg, 2.65mmol), palladium acetate (40mg, 0.177mmol), sodium carbonate (375mg, 3.53mmol) and ethanol (15ml).
Wet flash column chromatography (CH 2 Cl 2 /ethyl acetate 1:1) gave 6f a white solid (338mg, 73%).

div.head: 3) General procedure for asymmetric hydrogenations
div.p: A mixture of didehydroamino acid Z-6 and either [Rh(R,R)-Et-DuPhos(COD)]BF 4 or [Rh(S,S)-Et-DuPhos(COD)]BF 4 (1 mol%) were stirred in degassed methanol under 100psi of hydrogen. The mixture was concentrated and run down a short column (EtOAc) of silica to yield the pure product.

div.head: 3.1) Synthesis of (2R,3S
div.p: )-2-Acetylamino-3-phenyl-butyric acid methyl ester (2R,3S)-7a

AcHN CO 2 Me Me H H The general procedure was followed using alkene 6a (300mg, 1.29mmol), [Rh(R,R)-Et-DuPhos(COD)]BF 4 (8.4mg, 0.013mmol)) and methanol (5ml) at 100psi for 72 hours. Work up yielded (2R,3S)-7a as a white solid (300mg, 99%). M.p. 82-86°C; ν max (Film) 1541 (NH bend), 1657 (C=O amide), 1743 (C=O ester) , 3289 cm -1 (NH stretch); (200MHz, CDCl 3 ) 1.47 (3H, d J=7.4Hz, CH 3 ), 2.06 (3H, s, COCH 3 ), 3.25 (1H, quin. J=7.0Hz, CH), 3.62 (3H, s, CO 2 CH 3 ), 4.87 (1H, dd J=6.6&9.0Hz, CH), 6.20 (1H, d br. J= 8.6Hz, NH), 7.21-7.41 (5H, m, ArH); m/z (ES + ) 236 (MH + ); [α] 21 D -47.4° (c=0.27, CHCl 3 ). HPLC: Chiracel OD-H; R t (min) 16.34 (99.3%), 20.22 (0.7%).

div.head: 4) General procedure for hydrolysis
div.p: HCl (4N, 20ml) was added to a stirring solution of protected amino acid 7 (250mg) in acetone (2.5ml) and the mixture was heated under reflux for 3 hours. The mixture as treated with decolourising charcoal before filtering and concentrating. Trituration with acetone gave the pure product.

div.head: 4.1) Synthesis of (2R,3S
div.p: )-2-Amino-3-phenyl-butyric acid hydrochloride (2R,3S)-1a
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H HCl
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-7a (250mg,1.06mmol), acetone (2.5ml) and HCl (20ml) and yielded (2R,3S)-1a as a white solid (201mg, 88%

div.head: 4.2) Synthesis of (2R,3S)-2-Amino-3-(4-fluorophenyl)butyric acid hydrochloride (2R,3S)-1b
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H HCl F
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-7b (253mg, 1.0mmol), acetone (2.5ml) and HCl (20.0ml) and yielded (2R,3S)-1b as a white solid (181mg, 78%

div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H HCl F 3 C
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-7c (250mg, 0.83mmol), acetone (2.5ml) and HCl (20.0ml) and ether trituration yielded (2R,3S)-1c as a white solid (168mg, 71%

div.head: 4.4) Synthesis of (2R,3S)-2-Amino-3-naphthalen-2-yl-butyric acid hydrochloride (2R,3S)-1d
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H HCl
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-7d (250mg, 0.88mmol), acetone (2.5ml) and HCl (20.0ml) and yielded (2R,3S)-1d as an off-white solid (158mg, 68%

). M.p. 200-203°C; ν max (KBr) 1588 (amino acid II), 1770 amino acid I), 1978 (NH 3 + overtones and combinations), 2981 (OH), 3419cm -1 (NH 3 + ); δ H (200MHz, D 2 O) 1.46 (3H, d J=7.2Hz, CH 3 ), 3.64 (1H, quin. J=6.8Hz, CH), 4.22 (1H, d J=5.4Hz, CH), 7.41-7.91 (7H, m, ArH); m/z (FAB) 230 (MH + ); found (FAB) 230.11857 (MH + ), C 14 H 16 NO 2 requires 230.11810; [α] 22 D -10.0° (c=1.00, H 2 O). HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min) 17.12 (100%).

div.head: 4.5) Synthesis of (2R,3S)-2-Amino-3-(3,5-dimethylphenyl)butyric acid hydrochloride (2R,3S)-1e
div.p: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H HCl Me Me The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-7e (250mg, 0.95mmol), acetone (2.5ml) and HCl (20.0ml) and trituration with ether yielded (2R,3S)-1e as a white solid (205mg, 89%). M.p. 183-186°C; ν max (KBr) 1607 (amino acid II), 1733 (amino acid I), 2975 (OH), 3435cm -1 (NH 3 + ); δ H (200MHz, D 2 O) 1.32 (3H, d J=7.4Hz, CH 3 ), 2.21 (6H, s, (CH 3 ) 2 ), 3.38 (1H,quin. J=6.0Hz, CH), 4.03 (1H, d J=5.4Hz, CH), 6.91-6.98 (3H, m, ArH); δ C (63MHz, D 2 O) 15.2 (CH 3 ), 20.8 ((CH 3 ) 2 ), 40.0 (CH), 59.1 (CH), 126.0, 129.8 (C Ar ), 139.7, 171.5 (C); m/z (FAB) 208 (MH + ); found (FAB) 208.13378 (MH + ), C 12 H 18 NO 2 requires 208.13375; [α] 22 D -6.0° (c=1.00, H 2 O) HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min) 10.01 (0.5%), 12.81 (99.5).

div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2S,3R)-7a (250mg,1.06mmol), acetone (2.5ml) and HCl (20ml) and yielded (2S,3R)-1a as a white solid (204mg, 69%

). HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min) 7.56 (99.9%), 9.99 (0.1%). 4.8) Synthesis of (2S,3R)-2-Amino-3-(4-fluorophenyl)butyric acid hydrochloride (2S,3R)-1b H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H HCl F The general procedure was followed using (2S,3R)-7b (253mg, 1.0mmol), acetone (2.5ml) and HCl (20.0ml) and yielded (2S,3R)-1b as a white solid (178mg, 76%). M.p. 186-190°C; ν max (KBr) 1604 (amino acid II), 1732 (amino acid I), 1950 and 2530 (NH 3 + overtones and combinations), 2990 (OH), 3449cm -1 (NH 3 + ); δ H (200MHz, D 2 O) 1.41(3H, d J=7.2Hz, CH 3 ), 3.51 (1H, quin. J=6.2Hz, CH), 4.18 (1H, d J=6.0Hz, CH), 7.08-7.36 (4H, m, ArH); δ C (63MHz, D 2 O) 15.4 (CH 3 ), 39.4 (CH), 59.1 (CH), 116.0, 116.4, 129.9, 130.1 (C Ar ), 135.4, 160.6, 164.5, 171.6 (C); m/z (FAB) 198 (MH + ); found (FAB) 198.09318 (MH + ), C 10 H 13 FNO 2 requires 198.09303; [α] 22 D +4.5° (c=1.00, H 2 O
). HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min) 7.69 (99.6%), 9.67 (0.4%).

div.head: 5) General procedure for D-AAO stereoinversion
div.p: A mixture of amino acid hydrochloride (2R,3S)-1 (2ml of a 5mM solution), Trigonopsis variabilis D-amino acid oxidase (5 drops of immobilised slurry, 222.7 U/g dry weight) and ammonia-borane complex (5mg, 0.16mmol) were shaken on a blood rotator at 30°C. Samples were filtered and analysed by HPC at t=0 and t=20hr.

div.head: 5.1) Synthesis of (2S,3S)-2-Amino-3-phenyl-butyric acid (2S,3S)-1a
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-1a.

div.head: 5.2) Synthesis of (2S,3S)-2-Amino-3-(4-fluorophenyl)butyric acid (2S,3S)-1b
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H F
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-1b.
HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min): t=0hr 8.25 (100%); t=20hr 6.33 (100%); 68% yield; >99% d.e.

div.head: 5.3) Synthesis of (2S,3S)-2-Amino-3-(4-trifluoromethylphenyl)butyric acid (2S,3S)-1c
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H F 3 C
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-1c.
HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min): t=0hr 6.30 (1%), 7.82 (99%); t=20hr 6.05 (100%); 81% yield; >99% d.e.

div.head: 5.4) Synthesis of (2S,3S
div.p: )-2-Amino-3-naphthalen-2-yl-butyric acid (2S,3S)-1d
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-1d.

div.head: 5.5) Synthesis of (2S,3S
div.p: )-2-Amino-3-(3,5-dimethylphenyl)butyric acid (2S,3S)-1e
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H Me Me
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-1e.

div.head: 5.6) Synthesis of (2S,3S)-2-Amino-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)butyric acid (2S,3S)-1f
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H MeO
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2R,3S)-1f.

div.head: 6) General procedure for L-AAO stereoinversion
div.p: A mixure of amino acid hydrochloride (2S,3R)-1 (4ml of a 5mM solution), Snake venom L-amino acid oxidase (20mg of a 0.5U/mg enzyme) and ammonia-borane complex (10mg, 0.32mmol) were shaken on a blood rotator at 30°C.
Samples were filtered and analysed by HPLC at t=0 and t=20hr.
6.1) 6.1 Synthesis of (2R,3R)-2-Amino-3-phenyl-butyric acid (2R,3R)-1a
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2S,3R)-1a.
HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min): t =0hr 7.00 (100%); t=20hr 8.88 (100%); 83% yield; >99% d.e.
2) Synthesis of (2R,3R)-2-Amino-3-(4-fluorophenyl)butyric acid (2R,3R)-1b
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H F
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2S,3R)-1b.
HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min): t =0hr 6.79 (100%); t=20hr 8.69 (100%); 85% yield; >99% d.e.
3) Synthesis of (2R,3R)-2-Amino-3-(4-trifluoromethylphenyl)butyric acid (2R,3R)-1c
div.formula: H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H F 3 C
div.p: The general procedure was followed using (2S,3R)-1c.
HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min): t =0hr 6.48 (100%); t=20hr 7.94 (100%); 92% yield; >99% d.e.
6.4) Synthesis of (2R,3R)-2-Amino-3-naphthalen-2-yl-butyric acid (2R,3R)-1d

H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H The general procedure was followed using (2S,3R)-1d. HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min): t =0hr 9.08 (100%); t=20hr 9.82 (1.2%), 11.96 (98.8%); t=40hr 12.50 (100%); 80% yield; >99% d.e. 6.5) Synthesis of (2R,3R)-2-Amino-3-(3,5-dimethylphenyl)butyric acid (2R,3R)-1e H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H Me Me The general procedure was followed using (2S,3R)-1e. HPLC: Chirobiotic T; R t (min): t =0hr 7.28 (100%); t=20hr 7.28 (52.8%), 8.26 (47.2%); t=40hr 7.43 (32.6%), 8.41 (67.4%); t=64hr 7.36 (25.5%), 8.27 (74.5%); 71% yield, 49% d.e. 6.6) Synthesis of (2R,3R)-2-Amino-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)butyric acid (2R,3R)-1f H 2 N CO 2 H Me H H MeO
The general procedure was followed using (2S,3R)-1f.

div.head: 7) Stereoinversion on 1g scale
div.p: A mixture of β-methylphenylalanine hydrochloride (2R,3R)-1a (1.00g, 4.64mmol), ammonia-borane complex (3.10g, 100mmol), T. variabilis D-AAO (10ml of immobilised slurry, 222.7 U/g dry weight) in water (200ml) was shaken at 37°C for 96hr. HPLC showed complete conversion with 54% yield. The mixture was filtered and freeze dried, taken up in boiling ethanol and hot filtered to remove unreacted ammonia-borane. Recrystallisation from ethanol/ethyl acetate gave (2S,3R)-1a as a white solid (455mg 55%
